text: Residential development should provide a mix of housing types and sizes to meet identified local needs. Priority should be given to family housing (3+ bedrooms) in areas with good access to schools and open space.

All new residential development must achieve high quality design that respects the character of the surrounding area. Proposals should demonstrate how they contribute positively to the local streetscape.
Development near conservation areas must preserve or enhance their character and appearance. Building heights should not exceed the prevailing context by more than one storey.

Materials used in development adjacent to conservation areas should be of high quality and complement the existing palette. Modern interpretations are acceptable where they demonstrate design excellence.
The borough will accommodate 15,000 new homes over the plan period, with a focus on brownfield sites near public transport hubs. Development should support sustainable patterns of growth.

All major developments must be accompanied by a Transport Assessment demonstrating acceptable impacts on the local highway network. Car parking should be provided at no more than 1 space per 2 units in areas with PTAL 4 or higher.
